item.title: Serving a knative function on the root
item.description: I want to deploy everything as a knative service, including the root of the domain. I can't figure out how to do this with kourier, so here is an example of a work around. Add ingress-nginx helm upgrade --install ingress-nginx ingress-nginx \ --repo https://kubernetes.github.io/ingress-nginx \ --namespace ingress-nginx --create-namespace Configure letsencrypt Make sure to change your email address nginx-certs.yml: apiVersion:cert-manager.io/v1kind:ClusterIssuermetadata:name:letsencrypt-prod-nginxspec:acme:# You must replace this email address with your own.

item.title: Setting up knative
item.description: Let's walk through how to setup a k8 cluster on digitalocean with knative. Digital Ocean Start the cluster Installing and configure the doctl tool. Then setup a cluster: doctl kubernetes cluster create gratitude \ --auto-upgrade \ "--node-pool=name=default;min-nodes=1;max-nodes=10;size=s-4vcpu-8gb;auto-scale=true" Once that's in place, make sure that you have a domain, in my case gitgratitude.com: doctl compute domain create gitgratitude.com Installing knative We are going to use the knative operator to setup the install.
